mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Manual to the palms of Ecuador

mods:originInfo.mods:publisher: AAU Reports 37. Department of Systematic Botany, University of Aarhus, Denmark in collaboration with Pontificia Universidad Catï¿½lica del Ecuador

div.p: Understorey palm. Stems solitary or clustered, to 3 m tall and 5 cm in diameter. Leaf sheath open; blade 0.5-2.0 m long, simple or regularly divided into 8-20, broadly lanceolate to nearly sigmoid pinnae on each side, these narrowed at the tip into a slender, up to 6 cm long point. Inflorescence unbranched or with up to 11 branches; peduncle to 50 cm long. Fruits black, globose, 8-10 mm in diameter. Morphology of seedling leaves not known.
Patchy in Panama and Colombia W of the Andes, and in a small area on the E slopes of the Andes in Ecuador.
Two varieties are recognised. The Ecuadorian plants apparently correspond to var. semispicata
